definition: Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
surname Xu
to allow/to permit/to promise/to praise/somewhat/perhaps
careful/cautious

sentences.english: Such a structure reflects the philosophy of the writer.
sentences.chinese: 這種編纂法也反映了許慎的哲學思想。

sentences.english: The use of the skull echoes Xu Shen’s definition of the fox as a vehicle for ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 利用骷髏，迴應了許慎的狐狸定義“鬼之乘物”。

sentences.english: "At this point, Duanshi corrected Xu Shen's argument that" Lun also voice.
sentences.chinese: 在此，段氏糾正了許慎的說法，認爲“侖亦聲”。

definition: sound and meaning
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
History of the Liao Dynasty, twenty first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 116 scrolls
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
dictionary/encyclopedia
Rizhilu or Record of daily study, by early Confucian philosopher Gu Yanwu 顧炎武|顾炎武

Prime tortoise of the record bureau, Song dynasty historical encyclopedia of political essays, autobiography, memorials and decrees, compiled 1005-1013 under Wang Qinruo 王欽若|王钦若 and Yang Yi 楊億|杨亿, 1000 scrolls
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
almanac
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
